Two people agreed to meet between 1 PM and 2 PM. Each one comes randomly in this interval and stays for 30 minutes. What is the probability that they actually meet ?



::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
## ðŸ’¡ Hint

Parametrize the problem using two uniform distributions and compute the partial area corresponding to the meeting.
:::

::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
## ðŸ’¡ Solution

Let $X\sim \mathbb{U}([0,1]), Y\sim \mathbb{U}([0,1]), X \perp Y$ be the time or arrival of the two people. We want to compute $\mathbb{P}(|X-Y| \le 1/2)$

Since the two uniforms are positive, the possible region is $$\begin{cases} x \ge 0 \\ y \ge 0\end{cases}.$$

The meeting happens if  
$$\begin{cases} x - y\le 1/2\\  y -x \le 1/2  \end{cases} \sim \begin{cases} y \ge x-1/2 \\  y \le x +1/2  \end{cases}.$$

We can plot the regions and we find $\boxed{\mathbb{P}(\text{Meet}) = \frac{1-2*\frac{1/2*1/2}{2}}{1}= 3/4.}$

```{python}
#| echo: false

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

n = 1000
x = np.linspace(0, 1, n)
y = np.linspace(0, 1, n)
X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y)

possible = (X >= 0) & (Y >= 0) & (X <= 1) & (Y <= 1)

meeting = (
    possible &
    (Y <= X + 0.5) &
    (Y >= X - 0.5) )

plt.figure(figsize=(6,6))
plt.contourf(X, Y, possible, levels=[0.5,1], colors=["red"], alpha=0.5)
plt.contourf(X, Y, meeting, levels=[0.5,1], colors=["blue"], alpha=0.8)

plt.xlabel("x")
plt.ylabel("y")
plt.title("Meeting Region for Arrivals x, y")
plt.xlim(0,1)
plt.ylim(0,1)
plt.gca().set_aspect('equal')
plt.show()
```
:::
